snippet: The five conservative justices have made the Supreme Court an aggressive political actor. No wonder the court’s standing in public opinion polls is dreadful.
abstract: Editorial contends that the Supreme Court's majority decision to reject the individual mandate under the Constitution's commerce clause underscores the aggressiveness of the court's conservatism and marks a stunning departure from the long-established legal consensus that Congress has broad power to regulate the economy.
lead_paragraph: The five conservative justices have made the Supreme Court an aggressive political actor. No wonder the court’s standing in public opinion polls is dreadful.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
